title: Structura Logo Font ID - looks like Pritchard or URW Oklahoma
content:
[Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825074834/http:/wtf2.myfonts.com/uploads/images/11/118b12e6445efa9e0b00bcfcf4309076.15202.jpeg)

So, I need to redraw this logo and ofcourse all they had was this scan. I've been looking for the font of both "Structura" and the information below. Have tried Identifont and WhatTheFont, but no luck.

The font above looks very much like Pritchard or URW Oklahoma or Adobe ITC Anna, but differs slightly, especially the "R".

Help would be, ofcourse, greatly appreciated.  
Kind regards,  
Tom Swinnen
author: Thorens

comments.content: That's what I thought at first too, Rainer. I condensed it down, though and it doesnt' really work. DecoTech is closer, but still no. Still searching, 'cause I'm sure I've seen this ...

It's a hard one this, so it seems. DecoTech has the similar "C" but there's that different R again.

Anyway, already thanks for helping me look for this. I'm close to just drawing the letters.

Any ideas on the font for "Business and Residential Property", by the way?
re. b&rp, the scan isn't clear, but it could be myriad condensed, or even gill sans condensed, although the 'R' looks wrong for this
re. structura, are you sure someone hasn't taken itc anna and messed about with it?
